intro: Hesperis erysimodes, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows and along roadsides. Hesperis erysimodes is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
